DESCRI

decision_conditions: The development hereby permitted shall begin before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.Reason: This is required by Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

The modular unit hereby approved shall be removed from the site within 5 years of the date of this decision notice, to include services and associated connections and structures, and the land made good.Reason: The modular unit hereby approved is a temporary building. Were the building to be a permanent addition to the site a higher quality of design and sustainability standard would be required in accordance with Policies DM10 and DM1 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012).

Within 6 months of the date of this decision notice, the replacement car parking located on the former site of the Roehampton Wing (as shown on Drawing No. M9982-HUN-GYN-02-0001, Rev XB, Location Plan) shall be provided in accordance with drawing ref: 'PMA Layout v19e- Vehicle & Pedestrian Routes - New Parking on Site of Roehampton Wing' and shall thereafter be retained in perpetuity for the use of patients/the public, unless otherwise first agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure that sufficient replacement on-site car parking is provided and thereafter retained for the approved uses in accordance with Policies DM8 and DM9 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012).

The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the tree protection measures shown on Drawing Number: 1677-KC-XX-YTREE-TPP01Rev0, Tree Protection Plan and as detailed within the Arboricultural Method Statement dated July 2021, unless otherwise first agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure the protection of retained trees in accordance with Policy DM10 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012).

Within 6 months of the date of this decision notice, a detailed tree planting/replanting and landscaping scheme shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. The submitted scheme shall be based upon drawing ref: 'ADP-GY-00-DR-A-0902, Rev S2-P6, Proposed Site Plan', and shall include species type and size. The approved scheme shall be implemented within the first planting season following substantial completion of the development. The tree planting and landscaping shall thereafter be maintained for a period of five years to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or shrubs which die, are removed or become diseased during this period shall be replaced during the following planting season, and the areas shown to be landscaped shall be permanently retained for that purpose. Alterations to the landscaping scheme must be agreed in writing by the local planning authority.Reason: To ensure a satisfactory appearance on completion of the development and to ensure sufficient replacement tree planting and landscaping, in accordance with Policy DM10 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012) and Policy G7 of the London Plan (2021).

The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the Construction Phase Plan prepared by Wernick Buildings and the Risk Assessment & Traffic Management Plan (H&S 06/00c) prepared by Wernick Group, unless otherwise first agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To ensure that construction and associated works do not adversely impact the safety or navigability of the public highway in accordance with Policies DM9 and DM10 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012).

Evidence confirming that the development achieves a BREEAM (2014 version or relevant equivalent if this is replaced or superseded) rating of no less than 'Very Good' shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The evidence required shall be provided in the following formats and at the following times:a) a post construction assessment, conducted by an accredited Code / BREEAM Assessor and supported by relevant BRE accreditation certificates for each of the units, shall be submitted following the practical completion of the development and within 3 months of first occupation. In the event that the development cannot achieve a BREEAM 'Very Good', detailed evidence must be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority and supported by a schedule of enhanced sustainability measures to be implemented on the site. If it can be demonstrated that the development cannot achieve a BREEAM 'Very Good' then the development must achieve no less than a 'Good' and certification of the same must be provided in accordance with part (a) of this condition. The development shall be carried out strictly in accordance with the details so approved, shall be maintained as such thereafter and no change therefrom shall take place without the prior approval of the Local Planning Authority.Reason: In the interest of addressing climate change and to secure sustainable development in accordance with  Policies SI2 and SI5  of the London Plan (2021) and Policies DM 1 and DM 3 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012).

Any external lighting associated with the modular unit hereby approved must accord with the best practice guidance set out within 'Bat Conservation Trust and Institute of Lighting Professionals (2018) Guidance Note 08/18: Bats and artificial lighting in the UK' which includes:- Avoiding the use of unnecessary lighting;- Minimising the horizontal and vertical spread of lighting through the use of directional lighting;- Timers/bespoke dimming regimes;- Intensity and colour of lighting as low as possible whilst meeting the objectives of the intended function;- The use of narrow spectrum light sources;unless otherwise first agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.Reason: To minimise any adverse impact of the scheme on bats, in accordance with Policy DM10 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012) and Policy G6 of the London Plan (2021).

Within 6 months of the first beneficial occupation of the development hereby approved, a biodiversity enhancement scheme shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval in writing. The approved scheme shall be implemented in full and any enhancement measures thereafter retained and maintained in perpetuity. The scheme shall include, but not be limited to, the following:- Installation of bat boxes;- Installation of bird nesting boxesReason: To enhance the biodiversity value of the site in accordance with Policy DM10 of the Kingston Core Strategy (2012), Policy G6 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2021).

Prior to the commencement of any works above ground, a Fire Strategy shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. The Fire Strategy shall demonstrate how the development will achieve the highest standards of fire safety and shall include the following details: 1) suitably positioned outside space for fire appliances/ an evacuation assembly point; 2) Appropriate fire alarm systems; 3) Passive and active fire safety measures; 4) appropriate construction details to minimise the risk of fire spread; 5) provision of suitable and convenient means of escape/ an evacuation strategy; 6) provision of suitable access and equipment for firefighting which is appropriate for the size and use of the development. The Fire Strategy shall include a statement of competence. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details and thereafter maintained. Reason: In the interests of fire safety and to ensure the safety of all building users in accordance with Policy D12 (Fire safety) of the London Plan 2021. This is required prior to commencement as it goes to the heart of the scheme design
description: Demolition of existing Roehampton Building and erection of 48 surface car parking spaces and construction of part one, part two storey modular block with associated landscaping on existing surface car park.
